alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Dixon (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 22 at 3:28AM CDT until April 23 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM CDT SATURDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 7 PM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, south winds 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. For the second Wind Advisory, south winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...In South Dakota, Clay County. In Nebraska, Dixon and Dakota Counties. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to 5 AM CDT Saturday. For the second Wind Advisory, from 9 AM to 7 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Isolated stronger winds are possible near any thunderstorms tonight and Saturday. The strong winds will also lead to elevated fire danger, especially on Saturday.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
